alert.note: Alert for Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 07 at 10:43PM MST until December 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM FRIDAY TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Heavy bursts of snow and snow squalls will be possible between 8 AM and 2 PM. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Teller County, Rampart Range, Pikes Peak, and Northern El Paso County. * WHEN...From 8 AM Friday to 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft
